item.title: Poly Image Plane - ZLOC Part 1
item.description: An Image Plane is just a “Reflection” of a camera’s Film Back. We can figure out the Image Plane’s width and height by using some simple math. Lets make a Poly Image Plane by using this formula. First, create a camera. We will be using it’s default settings. Focal Length(mm): 35 Horizontal Film Aperture(inch): 1.417 Vertical Film Aperture(inch): 0.
